1. "The Imitation Game" (2014) - Starring: Allen Leech, Rory Kinnear, Benedict Cumberbatch. This movie tells the story of Alan Turing, a British mathematician and computer scientist who is best known for inventing Turing machines, which are able to process any possible input and can therefore be used to simulate any possible computing task. In this movie, the main character, played by Benedict Cumberbatch, is a brilliant mathematician who works for the British government during World War II. The main character's job is to help the British government break the German Enigma code, which was used by the German military to send secret messages over long distances. The main character is faced with many difficult challenges and obstacles while working on this project, including dealing with strict保密 requirements, working under tight deadlines, dealing with unexpected setbacks and obstacles, and trying to come up with creative and effective solutions to all of these problems and obstacles.

Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "Redacted" and "Gone with the Wind".
"Redacted" is a 2007 documentary film directed by Raja Sekhar, which was about the reconstruction of the rape and murder of a 15- year- old Iraqi girl by American soldiers in Samarra in 2006. The film was well-received and is often screened at schools and universities to educate students about this important issue.
"Gone with the Wind" is a 1939 American epic romantic drama film directed by George Cukor, which was based on a novel of the same name by Margaret Mitchell. The film stars Clark Gable as Rhett Butler, Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara, and many other well-known actors and actresses. "Gone with the Wind" is widely regarded as one of the greatest films ever made, and has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor (Male), Best Actress (Female), Best Supporting Actor, Best Supporting Actress, and several other awards.
